title: How extracting and producing nickel can be made more sustainable
content: Nickel is an important metal used in several clean energy technologies, especially electric vehicles. The demand for it is expected to surpass six million tonnes a year by 2040. However, producing just one tonne of nickel can result in more than 20 tonnes of carbon dioxide emissions

title: The story of how heeng came to be successfully cultivated in India
content: The first flowering and seed set of heeng at Palampur was reported on May 28, 2025, by CSIR, showing heeng can indeed be successfully cultivated in India; until early last decade India depended on imports; the government subsequently launched a national effort to promote indigenous cultivation which was led by the IHBT in Palampur, Himachal Pradesh

title: Oilers unravel as 'penalty chaos' reigns in Game 3

title: Dwarka fire: Man, 2 kids die after jumping from 8th floor to escape blaze
content: A tragic fire occurred at Shabad Society in Dwarka Sector 13. A 10-year-old boy and his sister died after jumping from their balcony. Their father, Yash Yadav, also died after jumping. His wife and elder son are receiving treatment. The fire started on the eighth and ninth floors. Firefighters evacuated all other residents. Authorities are assessing the building's structural integrity.

title: 'I didn't kill my husband': What Sonam Raghuvanshi told UP cops, what she didn't
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, missing for over two weeks, was found at a UP dhaba and arrested in connection with her husband Raja's murder during their honeymoon. Police allege she plotted the crime with lover Raj Kushwaha. While Sonam denies killing Raja, her silence on key details and missing jewellery deepen suspicion. Both families have demanded a CBI probe.

title: Russia unleashes drones, missiles on Ukraine; Zelenskyy urges global action
content: President Zelenskyy reported a massive overnight Russian attack on Ukraine, involving over 300 drones and 7 missiles, including North Korean-made ballistic missiles. Kyiv, Odesa, Dnipro, and Chernihiv regions were targeted, with a maternity facility in Odesa damaged.

title: 'New chapter to Indian space odyssey': IAF wishes Axiom-4 captain Shubhanshu Shukla
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is set to join the Axiom-4 mission to the ISS on June 11, marking a milestone for India’s space journey. The mission was delayed by weather. IAF bids wishes to Shukla. Isro officials are present for the launch alongside SpaceX and Axiom teams, as preparations continue at Kennedy Space Center.

title: Apple announces iOS 26: List of iPhones supported, availability and other things
content: Apple has introduced iOS 26, featuring a Liquid Glass interface and enhanced AI. The update includes a redesigned Photos app, smarter Siri, and a new Passwords app. Users can now mirror their iPhones to Macs. The update also brings improved Messages features and accessibility enhancements. iOS 26 is compatible with iPhone 11 and later models, with developer testing starting today.

title: Australia's Road to WTC Final: Aussies eye back-to-back titles at Lord's
content: Australia, the top-ranked Test team, is set to clash with South Africa in the World Test Championship Final at Lord's on June 11. Led by Pat Cummins, the Aussies aim to defend their title after a dominant campaign marked by 13 wins in 19 matches.

title: India's poverty rate continue to decline as SBI projects 4.6% rate for 2024
content: India is making great progress in reducing poverty. A recent State Bank of India report projects poverty to fall to 4.6 percent in 2024. World Bank data also shows a significant decline in the last decade.

title: iOS 26 Developer Beta 1 for iPhones now available: Read Apple's cautionary note
content: Apple has released iOS 26 beta 1 for developers, showcasing a major redesign with the new Liquid Glass design language. Available on iPhone 11 and later this fall, the update can be accessed through the free Apple Beta Software Program. Users are cautioned about potential instability and compatibility issues, recommending installation on secondary devices with prior backups.

title: 'Post vacant for 2 LS terms': Kharge writes to PM; presses for election of Lok Sabha dy speaker
content: Mallikarjun Kharge, Congress chief and Rajya Sabha leader of opposition, has urged PM Narendra Modi to hold an election for the Lok Sabha Deputy Speaker from the principal opposition party. Kharge highlighted that the position has been vacant for two consecutive Lok Sabha terms, which he argues violates constitutional provisions and democratic norms.

title: OH NO! TNPL player's bat breaks in the middle, hits bowler on the leg; watch video
content: In an unforgettable moment during a Tamil Nadu Premier League clash, K Aashiq's bat unexpectedly splintered mid-swing, hitting bowler Emmanuel Cherian. This peculiar incident unfolded as the Chepauk Super Gillies triumphed over Nellai Royal Kings by 41 runs. Chepauk Super Gillies amassed a formidable score of 212 for 7, with Aashiq contributing a solid 54.

title: Bengaluru suitcase horror: Teen from Bihar killed for refusing physical relationship
content: A 17-year-old girl from Bihar was lured to Bengaluru with a false promise of marriage and killed for resisting a physical relationship. Her body was found stuffed in a suitcase near railway tracks at Chandapura. The main accused, a married man, tried to stage her death as suicide. Eight suspects, including a minor, were arrested after a house owner's photos and a viral image of the victim helped police crack the case. The incident has been termed a horrific act of betrayal.

title: Steve Jobs told Apple CEO Tim Cook: Never to stay married to .., skill he says he learnt late
content: Tim Cook credits Steve Jobs with teaching him the invaluable skill of rapidly changing his mind when presented with new evidence, a trait powered by emotional intelligence. Jobs's ability to shift direction and let go of pride influenced Cook and many others, including Jeff Bezos, Jony Ive, and Marc Benioff.

title: Honeymoon murder: Sonam kept sharing her live location with Raj on trip
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi allegedly orchestrated her husband's murder during their honeymoon in Meghalaya, with the help of her lover, Raj Kushwaha, and three hired killers. She maintained constant contact with Raj, sharing her location to aid the crime. After her husband was found dead, Sonam was discovered disoriented in Uttar Pradesh.

title: South Africa's Road to WTC Final: Proteas eye long-awaited ICC glory
content: South Africa are set to clash with Australia in the World Test Championship Final at Lord's. Temba Bavuma will lead the Proteas, aiming to secure their first ICC title in 25 years. South Africa topped the WTC points table, showcasing strong performances. Key players like Aiden Markram and Kagiso Rabada are crucial for South Africa.

title: RCB stake sale soon? Diageo weighs options; may seek $2 billion valuation
content: Diageo is considering selling a part of its stake in Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) cricket team. The team's value may beestimated at $2 billion. Diageo is consulting advisors on a potential stake sale.

title: The burning ship: 4 crew missing, 18 rescued - how crisis unfolded
content: A container explosion aboard the Singapore-flagged MV Wan Hai 503 sparked a major fire off Kerala's Kannur coast. Eighteen crew were rescued by the Indian Navy and Coast Guard, while four remain missing. The vessel, carrying hazardous cargo, remains adrift. Rescue efforts involve multiple ships and aircraft, as authorities work to contain the fire and prevent environmental damage.

title: Karnataka SSLC 2: Where and how to check once released?
content: Karnataka School Examinations and Assessments Board (KSEAB) is expected to announce the SSLC Exam 2 Result 2025 soon, for supplementary exams held from May 26 to June 2, 2025. Students can access results on karresults.nic.in and kseab.karnataka.gov.in by entering their registration number. The result determines eligibility for higher secondary admission. The board has not yet confirmed the announcement date.

title: Defamation case: Gokhale apologises to Puri; calls allegations 'unverified'
content: Trinamool Congress MP Saket Gokhale has apologized to Lakshmi Puri, wife of Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri, for his defamatory social media posts regarding a property purchase in Switzerland. Gokhale expressed regret for the unverified allegations made in June 2021.

title: SRK's Mannat's renovation: Gauri Khan rents Rs 1.35 lakh 2 BHK apartment for staff
content: As Mannat undergoes renovation, Gauri Khan has rented a 2BHK apartment in Mumbai’s Pali Hill for her staff at ₹1.35 lakh per month. The Khan family, including Shah Rukh, has shifted to twin luxury duplexes in Puja Casa. Mannat, set to become grander with two additional floors, holds deep emotional value and was originally designed by Gauri herself.

title: 'Honor killing': Gurgaon executive strangled, set on fire by dad, brother over live-in
content: In Muzaffarnagar, a woman's father and brother have been arrested for allegedly murdering her due to her live-in relationship. Saraswati Maliyan, 23, was strangled and her body set ablaze in a forest. The family initially filed a missing person's report to mislead police. Identification was made through bangles found on the body.

title: 'Haath me red cherry': Arshdeep reveals training highlights as Team India begins Test prep
content: Team India has started preparing for the Test series against England in Kent. Arshdeep Singh describes the training location as peaceful and homely. The team focuses on regaining rhythm with the red ball after playing white-ball cricket. Players like Shubman Gill, Rishabh Pant, and Jasprit Bumrah are participating in drills.

title: Watch: Sid Mallya upset after RCB celebration video gets removed; explains Instagram ban
content: Siddharth Mallya, son of RCB's former owner, celebrated Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL 2025 victory with an Instagram video. However, the video was removed due to copyright infringement claims, leading to a temporary ban for Mallya. He revealed that IPL authorities requested the takedown, citing copyright violations, which he found upsetting as it hindered his celebration and interaction with fans.

title: FDs lose sheen! This investment option is becoming popular - here’s why
content: With declining bank fixed deposit rates following RBI's repo rate cuts, retail investors are increasingly turning to corporate bonds for higher yields. State-guaranteed securities, NBFC bonds, and small finance bonds offer attractive returns, facilitated by online platforms.

title: China's rare earth curbs 'wake-up call', says Goyal; India builds alternatives
content: Piyush Goyal has called China's rare earth export restrictions a global wake-up call, urging supply chain diversification. He highlighted India's efforts to develop alternative sources and become a reliable partner, addressing potential challenges for the automotive and white goods sectors. The government is supporting domestic production and exploring technological solutions to reduce dependence on Chinese materials.

title: KSCA pays price for stampede, BCCI shifts matches out of Bengaluru
content: Following a stampede at Bengaluru’s M Chinnaswamy Stadium, the BCCI has shifted the India ‘A’ vs South Africa ‘A’ ODI series to Rajkot. While KSCA denies any link, sources suggest more events could be relocated. Concerns grow over the stadium's condition and Bengaluru’s role as a future cricket venue.

title: 'Being made scapegoat': IPS officer challenges suspension order over Bengaluru stampede
content: Suspended IPS officer Vikash Kumar Vikash challenged his suspension over the June 4 Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede, calling it unjust and claiming he was made a scapegoat. The order cited failure in crowd control but lacked specifics on his alleged negligence. Nearly 30 retired IPS officers urged the CM to revoke the suspensions, stating police had warned organisers about safety risks. They argued that real accountability lies with RCB, KSCA, and event organisers, and punitive action should follow judicial inquiry, not precede it.

title: Trump refuses to sell red Tesla; here's all you need to know about the high-end Model S
content: Donald Trump has said he has no intention of selling his red Tesla Model S, dismissing speculation during a White House press briefing on Monday. “No, I may move the Tesla around a little bit,” Trump said when asked if he had plans to part ways with the electric car.

title: Nasa’s comet-catching tech inspires fashion revolution with ‘sky in bag’
content: Ioannis Michaloudis, a Greek artist, masterfully blends art and science by transforming NASA's aerogel, initially used to capture comet dust, into ethereal fashion accessories. His journey began with a cloud-shaped vision, leading him to discover aerogel's unique properties. This dedication culminated in the creation of the 'AirSwipe' bag for Coperni, captivating the world and showcasing the potential of science-inspired art.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are rates headed on June 10, in near term?
content: Gold price prediction today: The persistent risk of deflation in China's economy, along with favourable ETF movements and weaker-than-expected US employment data for May, provide support to gold prices. In the short term, however, the precious metal's direction is likely to be influenced by the current trade negotiations between the United States and China taking place in London.

title: 'RoKo, stop that': Ex-India cricketer slams clubbing Rohit & Virat together; says 'no comparison'
content: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar dismissed comparisons between Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in Test cricket, urging fans and media to “RoKo, stop that.” Highlighting Kohli’s superior record, especially in SENA countries, he asserted the two belong to different leagues in red-ball cricket, despite their white-ball reputations often being clubbed together.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the state government has issued orders on Monday transcribed to the government . a new government order has been issued on tuesday to transcribe the order .

title: NBA Finals betting: Thunder huge title favorites after blowout win
content: Oklahoma City Thunder beat the Indiana Pacers 123-107 in game 2 . the Thunder moved from -325 to -550 to win the title while the Pacers dropped down from +260 to +415 . in the finals MVP race, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (-550) is still the favorite by a wide margin .

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 25,100; BSE Sensex opens in green
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was above 25,100, BSE Sensex was above 82,500.

title: Meghalaya horror: Bride returned home 4 days after wedding to plot murder, say cops
content: A honeymoon trip in Meghalaya turned deadly when Raja Raghuvanshi was found murdered, initially suspected as a robbery gone wrong. However, investigations revealed a chilling plot involving his bride, Sonam, and her alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha.

title: Techie-lover stabs mom of two to death in Bengaluru hotel room
content: In a tragic turn of events, a 33-year-old woman, Harini R, was murdered by her 25-year-old lover, Yashas, in a Bengaluru hotel. The incident occurred after Harini decided to end their affair. Enraged, Yashas stabbed her multiple times. He later informed the police and attempted self-harm. Yashas has been arrested and is in police custody, while authorities investigate the crime.

title: SC clears Banke Bihari corridor in Mathura
content: Following Supreme Court approval, Mathura authorities initiated a land survey for the Banke Bihari corridor amidst local protests. The project aims to improve pilgrim experience with better facilities and crowd management after a 2022 stampede.

title: SC rejects plea of Thug Life release in K'taka: 'There are threats of arson'
content: The Supreme Court declined to protect cinemas screening 'Thug Life' in Karnataka after threats from pro-Kannada groups angered by Kamal Haasan's language comments. The Kannada Rakshana Vedike threatened arson, prompting a plea for security. Justice Mishra dismissed the petition, advising theatres to "keep fire extinguishers ready" and seek help from the High Court.

title: 'Faster than a pickpocket': Shastri's hilarious tribute as Dhoni inducted into ICC Hall of Fame
content: Former head coach Ravi Shastri hilariously compared MS Dhoni’s lightning-fast wicketkeeping to a “pickpocket” as the former India captain was inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame. Shastri praised Dhoni's composure and legacy. Dhoni called the honour “something I will cherish forever,” cementing his place among cricket’s all-time greats across all formats.

content: the WNBA season began just over three weeks ago . some teams have played only seven of their 44 regular-season games . but it's never too early to take stock of the candidates for MVP, Rookie of the year, Coach of the Year and several other end-of-season honors.

title: 💰 Nadal's winning racket sells for record price
content: a racket used by Rafael Nadal during his 2017 French Open final sold at a Prestige Memorabilia auction for $157,333.20 including buyer's premium on Sunday . the previous record was a Racket he used during the 2022 Australian Open . in 2017, he defeated Stan Wawrinka in straight sets, 6-2, 6-3, 6-1, for his record-extending 10th french Open title .

title: TGSRTC revises bus pass fares after three years
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the reopening of educational institutios is the first day of the year for educational institutions . it's a week of science writers' weekly newsletters .

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the latest news from the world of cinema and streaming will be published in 2025 . fda will be set up to provide a special cell for ffa .

title: From QB battles to rookie progress, here's everything we're watching at minicamps
content: the second week of NFL minicamps kicks off with 30 teams gathering for workouts after the Detroit Lions canceled their sessions . it's a chance to see who shows up after skipping voluntary workouts, how rookies perform against veterans, and how offensive and defensive systems look under new coordinators . the team has insisted that Cook will be playing for the Bills this season .

title: Sources: City closing on $45.6M deal for Cherki
content: the 21-year-old is set to arrive in a €40 million ($45.6 million) deal . a medical has been penciled in for Tuesday, and there's hope he will join pep Guardiola's squad ahead of the FIFA Club World Cup .
